snippet: An insurgent juggernaut that captured Iraq’s second-largest city and raced nearly 200 miles south in three days stalled on Saturday, leaving residents in Baghdad bracing for a siege that so far has not happened.
abstract: Rebel juggernaut that captured Iraq’s second-largest city and raced nearly 200 miles south in three days stalls; halt in advance of militants of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria leave residents in Baghdad bracing for a siege that so far has not happened; followers of rebel leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi instead work to consolidate their gains in predominantly Sunni parts of the country.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and ALISSA J. RUBIN
byline.contributor: Suadad al-Salhy contributed reporting from Baghdad, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: An insurgent juggernaut that captured Iraq’s second-largest city and raced nearly 200 miles south in three days stalled on Saturday, leaving residents in Baghdad bracing for a siege that so far has not happened.

headline.main: Iraq Rebels Stall North of Baghdad as Residents Brace for a Siege
headline.print_headline: Iraq Rebels Stall North of Baghdad as Residents Brace for a Siege

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
